result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

ADDRESS INFO for Stephanie Kay Rhadans
Current: 106 Barstow St, Horicon, WI 53032 United States  (Effective: 02-16-2017)
Prior: 413 1/2 S. Hubbard Street, Horicon, WI 53032

16CM75, 16CM100 & 16CM177: Defendant Stephanie Kay Rhadans in court with attorney Becky N Van Dam.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Van Dam has 75 and 100 and Atty. Smith has 177; Atty. Smith's case to be D&RI; discussion held; victim rights complied with; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads Guilty to both counts in 16CM75; Court finds pleas made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of 16CM75 with 16CM100 and 16CM177 D&RI; State heard; Atty. Van Dam heard; Court imposes sentence

**W/H - 15 mo. PO
- $363 CC each count
- $200 DNA sample and surcharge each count
- counseling
- AODA & FT
- absolute sobriety, no bars
Return date on July 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

16CM75 & 16CM100: Defendant Stephanie Kay Rhadans in court with attorney Becky N Van Dam.  Robert Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Van Dam heard on status - has new case coming in for Intitial in a couple weeks (16CM177) and is waiting to be appointed on that case, wants another return date; Court removes JT and orders RD reset to 7/18/16 at 1:30pm
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

16CM100 Defendant Stephanie Kay Rhadans in court with attorney Becky N Van Dam.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 signature bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Return date scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
